intro: Arrabidaea pliciflora, commonly known as the Cape York thornveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a woody stem and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
